definition: a sure catch/sth one is sure to obtain

sentences.english: Is Federer at least safe at No. 2?
sentences.chinese: 费德勒至少是稳获年终第二了吧？

sentences.english: Stats do not concede us to be certain of the Scudetto.
sentences.chinese: 数据并没有显示我们已经稳获冠军。

sentences.english: From what we have known, you are sure to win first place in this comprehensive exam.
sentences.chinese: 已知的情况看，这次综合考试你稳获第一。

sentences.english: After that, I knew he was home free for the nomination.
sentences.chinese: 这之后，我就知道，他稳获提名了。

sentences.english: Why don't you try on the clothes and see if they fit?
sentences.chinese: 从已知的情况看，这次综合考试你稳获第一。

definition: a sure gain/sth one is sure to obtain
integral (calculus)/accumulated points (in sports, at school etc)/total credits earned by student/bonus points in a benefit scheme
(sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
total victory/to excel by far/name of a tank/slam
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
a seat (in a theater, stadium etc)/parliamentary or congressional seat
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
